content: knitting pattern eng 04 2023 chicky lace socks level ***** sizes us 6 5-9 5 f uk 4-7 eu 37-41 pattern cuff down you simply have to love these lace socks they are super easy to knit chicky lace and perfect for a beginning knitter of lace patterns within a few rounds you know the pattern by heart so you can easily watch your favorite series while you are knitting i wrote this cuff down pattern from socks my personal preference for knitting needles and choice of heel and toe for starting knitters i have written out the instructions in detail for the advanced feel free to make adjustments to suit your preference to knit these chicky lace socks you need 75-80 grams sock yarn of and knitting style anyway i wish your choice tips when choosing the pattern stitch is best visible you lots of knitting fun with solid light bright colors also pay attention to the gauge of the yarn you will find this on the label of the yarn this pattern is suitable for yarn with a gauge of 28 stitches x 40 row 10 x 10 cm fingering weight it is also of influence whether you are a tight or loose knitter and which knitting needles you choose if you want to be sure you picked the right size/yarn knit a sample first when you are a enthousiastic starter like me you just start and check along the way if the size is right materials i chose the yarn our tribe by scheepjes color number 984 it suits 75-80 grams 4 ply sock yarn fine with my knitting style and needles 2 5 mm you can also of your choice fingering choose yarn with another gauge for instance 30 stitches x 42 weight 28x40 sock knitting needles 2 5 mm row in that case the socks will be a little smaller so please check stitch marker along the way if the size is right crochet hook 2 5 mm darning needle there are many different ways to knit socks you can use short needles metal wooden or plastic needles or knit on circular needles i almost always use 5 short bamboo needles size 2 5 mm feel free to adjust to your liking a stitch marker is useful when you knit the heel of the sock you can do without but i like to use a crochet hook of 2 5 mm to pick up stitches for the gusset or to pick up dropped stitches especially when you knit with a soft yarn like alpaca stitches have a way of flying of the needles faster then they should you need a darning needle to close the sock and weave in the ends abbreviations st = stitch/stitches k = knit stitch p = purl stitch nld = needle/needles k2tog = knit 2 stitches together p2tog = purl 2 stitches together used stitches ribbing stitch * k2 p2 repeat
